abstracts.cdata!:
The West and Central Africa Air
            Transport Safety & Security Project of Africa has
            moderately satisfactory outcome with moderately
            unsatisfactory performance by the Bank and a moderately
            satisfactory performance by the borrower. Lessons learned
            are as followed: Need to simplify project design in a
            complex and challenging implementation environment;
            participating countries should be grouped by capacity;
            Appropriate common grounds (geographic proximity, same
            regional entities) should also be considered; Project
            readiness is essential to ensure timely implementation;
            Realistic implementation time frame should be used for multi
            country complex regional project; Performance indicators
            should be limited to what is key to monitor outcomes and
            outputs; M&E framework should include regional
            dimension; Project design should be more regionally
            integrated; Complementarity and coordinated actions are key
            to promote broader air transport regional activities.
